You already can spread your character in Rawr to other people: http://elitistjerks.com/rawr.php#Astrylian@US-Suramar, for example. We're working on letting you include whole character files that way, not just Armory lookups.

Lets assume for a moment that a mod did exist where your rawr gearing 'score' is available in game.

Each model has a different means of rating gear. 

For most DPS specs this is 'DPS'.  Some also have survival as part of their score, usually the survival part can be individually rated. How do you unify the different models into a single DPS scoring ?

Tanks have an entirely different ranking system.  And even there.  Would you take tank A over tank B they have the same total score, but tank A has more mitigation while tank B has more survival.

And then healers.  They use a different rranking yet again.

 

And of course.  Even if you COULD uniform the rawr scores... it would still be just as much fail and retarded as GearScore (although maybe slightly less), since this scoring doesn't in any form or way tell you if the person wearing that gear is managin to use his gear efficiently.

I have seen players in "crap" gear outperform players that had considerably better gear on numerous occasions.  GS works under the assumption that everyone is equally skilled at playing their class, and that all the items they're wearing are appropriate for them.  At best it can give you a rough indication that some people are obviously undergeared.  But just because someone is geared, doesn't mean they're good.  264 epics are 'easy' to get, it just takes a lot of dailies. You can buy some 264 BoE drops, and 264 crafted items.  Is someone decked in 264 BOE epics and emblem gear guaranteed to be good at playing that character ?

Not to mention.. I can put on any gear I want in Rawr. Are you expecting Rawr to constantly keep a tab on your current gear for this purpose? People will have to "armory" you anyways to verify your Rawr gear matches your actual gear. I suppose then we need another mod to do that for us, too. With all of these mods designed to circumvent having actual knowledge of the classes, stats, and gear, Blizzard may as well take the guessing away from us and just match us like in 5-mans. We all know how well THAT goes. :D

When organising pugs, I personally use two awesome mods called 'brain' and 'notebook'.

Notebook is a mod where I can write down notes about how a player performed in a raid, if they emo'd out, or otherwise behaved (im)properly. Getting noticed positively gets you bonus points, geting noticed in a bad way gets you negative points, if you  manage to just not get noticed at all, that's usually a good thing too.

Brain is the mod that searches the info in Notebook and determines if I even wanna invite that person to the raid to begin with. For people not in the notebook at all, a quick armory check and a talk with the person that is vouching for the potential invitee is enough. Vouching for someone that turns out to be an annoyance gets you bad points as well btw.  That feeds back into Notebook. 

Works miracles !

I could see this as potentially working, if one were driven enough.  However, it doesn't work into the Rawr philosophy, so we're really not inclined to spend the development time on such a sideproject.
